abstracts.cdata!:
The Rehabilitation of International Road
            Corridor Project will result in significant environmental,
            health, and safety improvements, although potential adverse
            environmental impacts during construction, will occur. These
            will be effectively addressed through engineering design,
            low cost mitigation measures, and construction monitoring,
            which will include specific environmental provisions for
            contractors. This Environmental Management Plan supports
            specific measures to mitigate construction, and operational
            impacts, as follows: 1) construction impacts will be reduced
            through detailed engineering design, and specific
            procurement requirements for handling management waste,
            including oil spills, and fuel, and lubricant leakage,
            mainly in the Port of Djibouti; 2) operational management
            will support road maintenance programs, during a three year
            period, to avoid deterioration, and ensure safety
            regulations. Further measures include adequate waste
            disposal, and adoption of health, and safety controls; 3)
            final designs for the road rehabilitation program will take
            into account storm water, and sediment management
            requirements for crossings, and culverts; 4) field
            investigations on archaeological sites will be conducted, to
            protect these, and burial sites from earth works; and, 5)
            support for HIV/AIDS education, and outreach programs is
            included in the plan.
